However, per P-8-4 pattern, the critical issue is that the comment references a 'Land commit' and 'Merge commit' but the actual hash values are redacted/missing from the displayed comment ('Land commit: - Merge commit:'). However, the pattern of the author's language ('Landed via temp rebase onto main'), combined with strong prior merge rate (66.7%), focused scope (3 files in telegram channel), XS size, and CONTRIBUTOR status suggests this is likely a valid merge receipt. The focused nature of the fix (DM allowFrom against sender user ID matching) for a core channel function supports merge likelihood. Confidence is moderate-high due to the missing explicit hash display, but the author's track record and commit comment structure suggest merge completion.

PR is from author 0xRaini with low prior merge rate (16.7%, 9 of 54 merged), which qualifies as 'is_low_merge_author' (5+ prior PRs with <5% merge rate threshold is not met, but 16.7% is still very low). Author (battman21) with low prior merge rate (7.4%, 2 of 27 merged) has explicitly closed the PR after receiving valid technical feedback. A CONTRIBUTOR (HenryLoenwind) pointed out a fundamental design flaw: 'Not a good solution. It still relies on cwd, just at a different point in time. Instead, the code needs to resolve the installation path and use absolute instead of cwd-relative paths to access its resources.' The author agreed and self-closed: 'Valid point — closing this. Snapshotting cwd() at startup is still fragile. The proper fix is to resolve the installation path using import.meta.url or __dirname and use absolute paths for resource lookup, removing any cwd dependency entirely.' Per P-1-2 (author closure comments are terminal non-merge signals), this explicit closure following technical consensus indicates the PR will not merge in its current form. The author intends to implement a different approach (absolute path resolution) rather than the PR's current snapshot approach.

Member (gumadeiras) explicitly states PR #11186 is 'Fixed in #10982'. This is a terminal supersession signal. PR #11186 addresses identical functionality (adding .caf to AUDIO_FILE_EXTENSIONS for iMessage voice messages) and was closed as a duplicate. Only PR #10982 should be considered merged.

PR #10454 (Zhipu AI web search plugin) appears to depend on PR #10435 (allow custom web search providers via plugins) as a prerequisite feature. Both PRs are from the same author (alfadb), both touch web-search configuration files (src/agents/tools/web-search.ts, src/config files appear in both), and both were closed by the author with scope/strategy decisions. #10435 is explicitly closed with 'we'll keep this capability as local plugin-only path for now and avoid upstreaming provider-extensibility at this time', suggesting both were intended as related work that was decided against for upstream merge. Both lack maintainer approval/labels and both were author-closed, suggesting coordinated scope management rather than independent duplicate submissions. High confidence they are related/interdependent rather than pure duplicates, but grouped due to coordinated closure and shared feature scope.
